style.aesthetic: incident response dashboard, root cause analysis tool, debugging interface, curved ultrawide monitor, industrial control room, cinematic

timeline_section.title: FAULT TIMELINE — ±10 SECONDS
timeline_section.description: Two stacked time series charts showing the 20-second window around the fault. Vertical red line marks fault moment.

charts.label: DC BUS VOLTAGE
charts.visual: line chart starting at 51.2V, stable for 5 seconds, then dropping sharply to 44.8V at fault line, continuing down to 42V after

charts.label: INVERTER FREQUENCY
charts.visual: line chart starting at 49.95Hz, slight drop as voltage drops, then sharp drop to 48.5Hz at fault, flatline after (inverter stopped)

charts.label: DISCHARGE CURRENT
charts.visual: line chart showing steady 95A, slight increase before fault, then drop to 0A at fault

panels.title: CELL VOLTAGES AT FAULT
panels.visual: 16 cells as colored squares, mostly yellow/orange (2.9-3.1V), Cell 14 bright red (2.85V)

panels.title: CLUSTER A NEIGHBORS
panels.note: Neighbors were supplying power but couldn't prevent LVP

panels.visual: text box with monospace font, dark background, looking like terminal output

sections.title: ROOT CAUSE
sections.text: Battery reached Low Voltage Protection (LVP) threshold due to high discharge rate (95A) combined with low SOC (12%) and weak Cell 14.

sections.title: EVIDENCE
bullets: DC bus dropped from 51.2V to 44.8V over 8 seconds

sections.title: PATTERN MATCH
sections.text: Similar to fault on 2024-01-03 (House 3) — Cell 14 was also first to trigger. Cell capacity degradation suspected.
